raw_fields: Deep skills first.  “Design learning requiring reasoning/reflection even when AI available.”
Strong north star. Optional tighten: reference “visible thinking.”
text: Deep skills first.  “Design learning requiring reasoning/reflection even when AI available.”

raw_fields: AI as coach.  “Use supports learning processes, not replacement of student work products.”
text: AI as coach.  “Use supports learning processes, not replacement of student work products.”

raw_fields: “Allow students to dive deeper into interest areas… love of learning…”
Valuable vision, but too broad/not AI-policy specific. Keep as supporting narrative, not a principle.
text: “Allow students to dive deeper into interest areas… love of learning…”

group_path: “Allow students to dive deeper into interest areas… love of learning…”

Good human-centered constraint; link to AI. Rewrite: “FCCPS will keep learning human-centered, balancing AI with hands-on, collaborative, and offline learning.”

raw_fields: “School will not change budgets until AI has shown benefit… off ramps.”
Principle is “pilot before scale + reversibility,” not budgets.  Rewrite: “FCCPS will pilot before scaling and maintain off-ramps if benefits do not materialize.”

I used these F3 checks: Clear actor + scope (FCCPS can actually do it)Single idea (not a bundle of 3–4 claims)Policy-level (direction/standard), not an implementation to-doTestable/operationalizable (someone could later write guidance/rubrics/controls)Not redundant (or explicitly marked to merge)Avoids absolutes that create unintended constraints (“no AI ever…”) unless truly required

raw_fields: Net result (what’s “clean” enough to keep moving) PASS (as principles now): all seed cards + 2 write-ins that can stand as principles with light polish (Student safety/developmental appropriateness, AI literacy for students+staff).REVISE: most write-ins (good intent, need to become policy-level, single-idea statements, often best as merges).PARK: items that are unclear, solution-specific (on-prem), redundant, or privacy-colliding (teacher access to AI-use history).If you want, I can take only the PASS + best REVISE-as-merge items and output a single consolidated set of revised candidate principles (still pre-F4 cap), preserving initials/tags.
text: Net result (what’s “clean” enough to keep moving) PASS (as principles now): all seed cards + 2 write-ins that can stand as principles with light polish (Student safety/developmental appropriateness, AI literacy for students+staff).REVISE: most write-ins (good intent, need to become policy-level, single-idea statements, often best as merges).PARK: items that are unclear, solution-specific (on-prem), redundant, or privacy-colliding (teacher access to AI-use history).If you want, I can take only the PASS + best REVISE-as-merge items and output a single consolidated set of revised candidate principles (still pre-F4 cap), preserving initials/tags.
